ai-iti103:1.1_0: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti103:2.1_0: “Mendicants, there are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
ai-iti103:2.1_3: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-iti103:2.2_0: I don’t regard them as true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables don’t realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and don’t live having realized it with their own insight.
ai-iti103:3.1_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
ai-iti103:3.1_3: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-iti103:3.2_0: I regard them as true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and live having realized it with their own insight.”
ai-iti103:3.3_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-iti103:4.1_0: “There are those who don’t understand suffering
ai-iti103:4.5_0: And they don’t know the path
ai-iti103:4.6_0: that leads to the stilling of suffering.
ai-iti103:5.4_0: they continue to be reborn and grow old.
ai-iti103:6.1_0: There are those who do understand suffering
ai-iti103:6.6_0: that leads to the stilling of suffering.
ai-iti103:7.1_0: They’re endowed with the heart’s release,
ai-iti103:7.4_0: they don’t continue to be reborn and grow old.”
ai-iti103:8.1_0: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
